page.title: 20LANGUAGE OF HOLMER GREEN
page.content: I have a grampy his name is Dan we call him Dan the pig farm man he talks a language all his own there's never an H in a word like home he has many strange sayings such as "I be"un"I baint"and"es comin" un gooin"and"e is un e aint." He says" giss a good rabbut.""Thats what I likes fur midinner"And arry the boar,"E's un ockard ol sinner,"He didn't say he was cold to my sister Les and he didn't say i'm freezing,he just said "I be frez"Then it's why up booy un ow-be-yon"and"weir ya bin"un"fer ow long"go acroars that medder un fetch that pig un put it in a sty cuz it ain't very big,he looks round his pigs both big and small then says"ah booy arrys the daddy on em ole." This is an example of Holmer Green language which is still spoken by the older members of the village today, particularly the Darvill family.
